> Reference: Boulton et al. 2022 [publication link](https://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/puzzles/doc/fifteen.html#fifteen)
> Reference: 2015 [publication link](https://www.instructables.com/How-To-Solve-The-15-Puzzle/)

## What is Fifteen Puzzle?

Fifteen Puzzle contains 4x4 square grid with 15 squared tiles from number 1 to 15 with sixteenth tile emptied. The goal of this game is to make 15 tiles in the correct numerical order from number 1 to 15 by moving them with one very bottom right tile emptied.

![Fifteen Puzzle](data:image/png;base64,)

### Difficulty And How It Works

> "This puzzle is considered easy by human subjects, although the solution length for a given instance of this puzzle varies substantially across subjects” - Zygmunt Pizlo and Zheng Li -

Fifteen Puzzle is considered easy meaning it can be considered as an average level of puzzle that can be enjoyed by anyone. It doesn’t contain difficult rules and goals, which impact people to be more concentrated in solving the puzzle without giving up or getting less interested. This is a strong advantage to keep people enjoy the puzzle but also help their brain to be active.

Despite the simple rules and goals of Fifteen Puzzle, it might still be difficult and take some time if the person isn’t familiar with how to move the pieces. Due to this, it can take 10 minutes or longer to finish the puzzle for beginners, but for people who are familiar might only take 1-2 minutes. Since this puzzle isn't too easy and short, by the end of the puzzle it gives a sense of accomplishment and entertainment to people.

One of the steps to follow in solving the puzzle is by trying to get numbers in order from 1 to 15.

1. Move 1 and 2 into their final position
1. Move 3 and 4 into a position where 4 is next to 2 on the right and 3 is under 4.
1. Move 3 and 4 into the final position.
1. Move 5 and 6 into the final position.
1. Move 7 and 8 into a position where 8 next to 6 on right and 7 is under 8.
1. Move 7 and 8 into the final position.
1. Move 13 and 9 into a position where 13 is under 5 and 9 is under 6
1. Move 9 and 13 into the final position.
1. Move 10 and 14 into a position where 14 is under 6 and 10 is under 7.
1. Move 10 and 14 into a final position
1. Complete the puzzle by moving 11, 12, and 15.

Other than these steps there are other ways that can be followed to complete the puzzle. By going through these steps, it helps people to navigate the correct direction and improve spatial and visual intelligence.
